website_summaries.verdict: The Brother ImageCenter ADS-1000W offers a lot to like, but it lacks a final polish, letting you scan to a USB key, for example, but making the USB port hard to get to.
pros: Can scan to USB memory key
One step scanning to image PDF, searchable PDF, Word format, and more
cons: Some minor oversights, including failing to install software that the installation program says it will install

customer_reviews.title: The paper is jammed all the time.
customer_reviews.text: , Because the feeding tray is not long enough to support the paper, the paper moves when feeding the scanner and for that reason, the paper is jammed all the time. It hurts the paper.
customer_reviews.author: Pattymaxwee

customer_reviews.title: CRAP
customer_reviews.text: Had it with this POS. Frequently "Forgetting" itself when I go to scan. Ate some pretty important documents once on me. Today was the last straw. Had a UPS Red pickup happening when it decided to pull its little "scanner can't be found" BS when trying to scan some license documents for a customer and getting the package ready, was in a bit of a rush.... Ended up taking pictures of the paperwork with my phone as the scanner forgot itself, for the last time, at the most inopportune moment.... Save you money, buy a Canon.
customer_reviews.author: DmacV2

customer_reviews.title: Wow. What a difference maker. We run a ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow. What a difference maker. We run a small medical office. We have to scan and upload documents into our electronic medical record system all day. This machine is fast, efficient, and headache free. A breeze to set up and run. And it has a dedicated slot for medical cards - does them front and back in one pass. A card scanner normally costs about $120-150 and does not include regular scanning capabilities. It's only been a week and my staff is raving. Should have bought this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Good scans but slow and unreliable
customer_reviews.text: For a basic document scanner this works fine but on my MacBook Pro running the latest OS it takes a long time to scan, especially multi page documents. That I can learn to live with. But I can't live with the scanner becoming unresponsive to commands. The only way to fix it is the remove the scanner proxy and rebuild it as if setting it up for the first time. So far this has happened 6 times in the 3 months I've had it. And I've had it! Mine is actively looking for a new home.
customer_reviews.author: Sequoia M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect substitute for the NEAT Scanner
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is amazing. I was originally looking for a NEAT scanner but I REALLY didn't like the price point that they were at. I started looking around and found this Brother scanner. I compared features and found that this scanner actually has more and better features than the NEAT scanner and it's a fraction of the price!! I received it in two days and it works perfect! I can scan drivers licenses', full sized sheets of paper, photos, business cards, you name it! It's completely awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Reeger2213

customer_reviews.title: but the worse part about this one is that it has trouble ...
customer_reviews.text: The scanner works well for the most part. Once in a while it wrinkles the pages... but the worse part about this one is that it has trouble connecting to your computer when you first turn it on. It's supposed to remember where to send your scanned images to (ftp, email, etc.), and supposed to let you press a single user-programmed button to send your scan to the corresponding computer... but I often have to use my computer to re-initiate the connection to get a successful scan. So, it's not really a one-push scanner.
customer_reviews.author: jcfromsanjose

customer_reviews.title: Brother Scanner
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this last year and have been able to use it quite a bit. I really like it! This scanner has a very small footprint and takes up little room on my desk. The quality of the scans are surprisingly good. I can also use it like a copy machine and scan and print with my printer (also Brother). Also, it allows me to scan and file documents in different folders on my computer, in addition to scanning an emailing. The price was quite economical and the performance exceeded my expectations. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: AJE-4

customer_reviews.title: scanner will not work with Mac 64-bit
customer_reviews.text: I've owned two of these scanners for several years. Over the course of the last two years, Apple has changed their OS and the scanners will not work with the Brother software. I can download drivers for the current version of Mac OS. But the software does not work. I had to hunt on the Brother site to learn that it will not work with modern versions of Mac OS. The article reads you can use Apple's scanning software, but it lacks functionality of the Brother software. Waste of money, IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A. Griffiths

customer_reviews.title: Ready to pull my hair out
customer_reviews.text: For the price of this scanner, I am very disappointed at how many issues I have had. Everything from jamming to VERY VERY VERY slow scanning (that has nothing to do with network connection and/or the PC the files are being scanned to). I bought this scanner less than a year ago and I am replacing it with the Fujitsu because I am about to pull my hair out dealing with the slow scan speeds. Complete waste of money - wish I had of followed my gut and went with the Fujitsu to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very consistent and reliable. If you encounter JAMMING check ...
customer_reviews.text: Very consistent and reliable. If you encounter JAMMING check the plastic strip at the1st set of rollers. Due to jarring or intense jamming, it may pop up. Just push it back down (You will hear a click or snap sound as it snaps into place) The strip is transparent and is hard to see if it is out of place.
customer_reviews.author: Herbert

customer_reviews.title: best scanner I have used!
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I got this scanner, it is working out very well. We are a small business and are having to keep a copy of everything. We didn't want to have to have a paper copy of everything and our old scanner wouldn't auto feed anymore and this one works better than any other scanner I have used. it's size is great too, I fold it up and it fits on the shelf by my desk until I need it. The double side scan is great, there is no 'bleed through' from either side, just a nice clean scan on both sides in one pass.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this unit. Had 2 Fujitsu units in the past and loved them.One bit the dust and had to replace it with this. The price difference was a lot. It does everything the other did. Very satisfied. I use at home,
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Does not work in high resolution mode
customer_reviews.text: If you're trying to scan 1200x1200 dpi you will be lucky to get 4 pages out before the software errors out saying there is not enough memory on the machine. In fact my machine shows 4gb of unused memory during scan operations when this error appears. Brother support is no help - their solution is reduce the number of sheet during each scan or reduce the resolution. At 2 sheets per scan it seems to work aright and would take a day and half to scan a couple of hundred pages...
customer_reviews.author: StackOverflow

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit For Medium Duty Home Use
customer_reviews.text: I just installed this scanner on my Windows 10 laptop system and the whole process was simple and problem free. I've done a few test scans in duplex mode, full color and the PDF files produced are identical in all respects. There are, I'm sure, many tricks I still need to learn but this unit is completely satisfactory for my purposes. In a heavy usage environment, perhaps a commercial grade scanner would hold up better but I won't be scanning more than a few hundred pages in any given month. At the listed price it's a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: B. Franz

customer_reviews.title: The device isn't truly OS X supported. They toss ...
customer_reviews.text: The device isn't truly OS X supported. They toss basic drivers in that nullify all features outside of their own software, and their software hardly works. Was actually told to modify my use case of the scanner, and office procedures by Brother support.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Atkins

customer_reviews.title: Fast scanning speed, only issue I had with this ...
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Lately I haven't been able to use this scanner because its inability to pull in a single sheet of paper in a straight path and thus made the scanned page crooked unevenly. I had to go back to my Epson flatbed scanner which worked flawlessly and reliably in the last 10 years! The paper feeding mechanism needs improvement to ensure papers get pulled in a straight path! ORIGINAL COMMENT: Fast scanning speed, only issue I had with this was some time it did not pull the paper straight and caused the scanned page crooked!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Gadget

customer_reviews.title: A simple and fast scanner.
customer_reviews.text: A reliable scanner. WIFI setup was no problem at all. Works very well. Its worth the money. The only button on the machine is a power button. All scanning is performed through the supplied software which is easy to install and easy to use. Works nicely on the latest version of Windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Davis

customer_reviews.title: Best Scanner Oh Brother
customer_reviews.text: This little scanner is so perfect & I have the neat scanner but I do not like it near as much as the brother scanner. Advantages are: small footprint, great scans, faster than neat scanner, and I have more control, better menu choices & simpler, and it's wireless. You need one of these!
customer_reviews.author: angelamazon

customer_reviews.title: It's an awesome product. Love it
customer_reviews.text: It's an awesome product. Love it. The scanner has done a wonderful job. The only issue I have with the product is the CD software and the manual. The CD software is not for the latest version of windows. I have to figure out the download for my version of windows by myself. All the download are available at their website. Overall it's a great product and value for money. I will recommend it 100 percent! Enjoy the paperless life!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BUY THE WARRANTY!
customer_reviews.text: worked for a couple of scans and now will not connect even thru USB. I bought the extended warranty so hoping for remedial. When it worked it was wonderfully easy easy for this 80 year old who wants to put her family pictures on the computer and file her medical receipts via this scanner!
customer_reviews.author: Toots

customer_reviews.title: Destroys documents
customer_reviews.text: I am actually afraid to use this scanner anymore. It has mangled so many documents that I've tried to scan. Cute, takes up very little space, seems like it should be wonderful, but it it terribly unreliable. I watch with horror as I see something I'm scanning start to get pulled through crooked and forced up against the side of the scanner until it rips. Then the machine stops and tells me there's a paper jam.
customer_reviews.author: BecTec

customer_reviews.title: Worked great at first
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first, now after 3 months of light use it's highly unreliable. I'm stuck with this garbage, I'm outside my window to return. Every other scan job the documents either jam or I receive an error "Failed to connect to device...." It's not ideal having to restart this scanner frequently or clearing out a jam to get it to scan.
customer_reviews.author: BS

customer_reviews.title: Not good for business cards, but good for basic images/pdfs.
customer_reviews.text: To be clear, this is a nice little scanner for documents. It's fast, easy to use, compact, etc. But I bought this for business card use, which the product advertised it could handle. It DOES NOT. The Presto BizCard software's OCR is apalling and even the simple image capture is pretty clunky. And several hours of tech support from Brother could not get their own OCR software to work on my machine (a simple Windows 8 laptop). So I returned this. Again, if you just need it for standard documents and stuff, probably a fair buy, but a waste of time and money for business card scanning.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Roney

customer_reviews.title: UNUSABLE- jams every scan and cannot continue scanning into same document once jams. Returned.
customer_reviews.text: UNUSABLE, returned it. The only pros: Quality of the scan are great and there are many options for image/picture/file and scan to usb/email/computer The BIG Cons: Pretty much jammed EVERY scan, unless paper was absolutely perfect... and then often would still jam. If it jammed the file would "complete" and you couldn't continue scanning into the same document after clearing the jammed, so if you jammed on page 99/100, you have to scan it all again. Made the scanner unusable so I returned it. I should have listened to the reviews about it jamming so much.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Banks

customer_reviews.title: The Installation Disk doesn't work!!! You need to download the software needed to connect it to your computer wirelessly!
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner - BUT...For starters the Install CD-Rom disk didn't work on the computers in my office (Which, the information online and in the box said that it was compatible with my operating systems) To connect it wirelessly, I had to go online and download a different installation software - for EVERY different computer in my office! I love this scanner, however, when I put in more than one page at a time, after 2 pages, it starts to feed the papers in skewed - not straight. Also, I would like it a lot more if it had a tray for already scanned papers, instead of it just shooting them out on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie Sworde

customer_reviews.title: Feed Problems
customer_reviews.text: This is probably unfair. I might have been using it wrong but I continued to have problems with paper not staying straight so the output was constantly off. Maybe If I spent more time, it might have gotten better but I didn't want to chance it so I returned the scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Savage

customer_reviews.title: It's really a great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This thing has changed my life! OK maybe that's a little dramatic, but I just dropped off 30 pounds of paper to be shred - and cleared up a ton of space in my file cabinet. The scanner works fast, recovers quickly from jams, and prompts you through each file so you won't lose track of your documents. It's really a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: EJL_LaLa

customer_reviews.title: Good product just didn't want to work with my PC
customer_reviews.text: My hopes were to set up this scanner quickly but when it would not work with my PC no matter how many times the software was downloaded and installed. Got Brother's technical support two days for help and they could get it to work. Don't want to say anything bad about the product things happen and this may be a wonderful scanner for someone else just not for me and if the Brother's technical staff can't make it work will have to find something more compatible. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: LJB

customer_reviews.title: Great compact duplex document scanner!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great document scanner. I needed something that was high speed and duplex and found it here! Only two minor cons outlined below. Pros: high speed, duplex scanning, one touch option, compact. (Minor) Cons: the quality is not as good as my flatbed for images (but I didn't buy it for that), You need to prop it up on something when doing lots (more than a few pages) of documents so it doesn't jam (I just sit it on top of the box it came in and that works perfectly).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I thought this small scanner would work perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: I thought this small scanner would work perfect for me; BUT NOT!!! There are too many flaws. It is nearly IMPOSSIBLE to scan any document straight. The small clasp on the side that are supposed to hold the item straight while scanning do not work. The missing tray to catch the documents is also an issue for me. There is no tab to straighten the item after you scan it. I wish i had not waited so long to write is review. I want to return this scanner! Please Please Please do not buy this one if you need your items to be scanned in accurately. Buyer beware. You get what you pay for!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: craig welscher

customer_reviews.title: Not up to claims
customer_reviews.text: Advertised as being able to handle up to 20 sheets of paper at one time but it always jams for us if we put in 10 or more.
customer_reviews.author: bobkap

customer_reviews.title: Best one yet.
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot and needed something that I can use at my home office and take with me to my field office. this is a perfect size and not heavy at all. Love the quality of scanning, you have options to change it to your preference.
customer_reviews.author: lexa_arce

customer_reviews.title: I've had this scanner since last year and was happy on how fast it scans the document
customer_reviews.text: I've had this scanner since last year and was happy on how fast it scans the document. The more I use it now the more the paper gets jammed up and rips my documents. This is happening very often especially with more than one page. There is nothing to guide the documents in neatly. I'm in the market for a new one as I can't stand trying to correct the issue every single time.
customer_reviews.author: Meaghan

customer_reviews.title: Good little scanner when the PaperPort software works
customer_reviews.text: Good little scanner when the PaperPort software works. But the paper feed does not allow pages to scan straight. The first one will go throught straight but the following pages shift and sometimes jam due to too much shifting. Also, if you do scan several pages you have to watch to make sure all pages don't go at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Diane K. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Jam and allignment issues.
customer_reviews.text: It can scan fast, but it's inconsistent. The settings are a pain to deal with, it hardly ever scans straight, the card/receipt sleeve jammed until I cut it to be just 6" long. If I'm not scanning multiple documents I'd rather use my 15 year old Microtek3600. Sadly, this thing has been a pain 50% of the time I have used it.
customer_reviews.author: Shard

customer_reviews.title: It paper jams a lot. It is not true ...
customer_reviews.text: It paper jams a lot. It is not true it scans 20 documents. Feeder takes the paper sideways and it jams, setting change by it self. Difficulty connecting to WiFi. I have remove and installed 3 times since purchased. Not a day that would work properly with out jamming.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth connection is awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love the Bluetooth connection. When I have tons to scan I can set up right by the shredder and get to business. I am having a hard time getting the machine to ignore blank pages so I am not sure what is up on that. This may sound picky but it requires 2 touches for each scan and I was hoping to only only have one. I scan a lot and it makes a difference. I have not seen a lot of skewed pages which is good. It is very compact and does not take up much room at all. Overall I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Momof6

customer_reviews.title: MAC users beware - sad to say goodbye
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to convert all my documents to digital. It’s small and simple to use for personal home needs. Receipts do jam if you don’t use the supplied accessory. Loved the duplex, auto feed feature. Hard to find in a small affordable scanner. ATTN MAC USERS: this will not work with the recent OS upgrade and Brother’s CS said they don’t plan on fixing the problem. Money down the drain. Do better Brother.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to deal with receipts and faxing and emailing documents, when paired with Adobe Pro you can do some pretty amazing things. This scans fully duplex over WiFi which makes things very nice. Portable and flexible connections.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work real well unless it's only one to two sheets of paper
customer_reviews.text: It works okay it's really fast but it doesn't like over three or four pages at a time and it has trouble keeping the pages straight. I would not purchase it again. There are other scanners that are less expensive which I have purchased since then and they work much better but are slower
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner for desktop work!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this scanner to replace a failed Neat scanner. It works great, fast scans, good software included with it. No hassle installs easy.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: It scans front side and back side of pages all at once which is super convenient and makes scanning really fast
customer_reviews.text: I had my manager set this baby up. It was fairly simple with a cd. The scanner can scan in B&W and color. It scans front side and back side of pages all at once which is super convenient and makes scanning really fast. Love that the page size adjuster can go really small. The only con i would have is that it can only handle 20-21 pages of paper at a time and doesn't have a paper catcher at the bottom. I also love that it's small and saves space.
customer_reviews.author: ghang93

customer_reviews.title: Wireless connectivity? BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: The wireless connectivity is a joke.....the description makes you assume that you can easily connect the scanner wirelessly to your phone for easy scanning and operation via an app. No....you need to have one-touch wifi and a router nearby. That doesn't help me when I am carrying this scanner around to scan files from govt offices. The whole point was to not bring a laptop. Super disappointed with the description. Not sure if I'm going to keep it....
customer_reviews.author: YJB

customer_reviews.title: Great, Small scanner
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these now for our department. They are super easy to setup. I have not used any of the additional features (business card and receipt scanning) as the scanners are not in my office. We use them to scan in material certs on a regular basis. Speed and quality matches that of a $1000+ HP that we were using. More importantly, the compact design is awesome! I can't comment on the wireless abilities. IT does not really like things like this on our Wi-Fi.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Skip this one...never works right
customer_reviews.text: Misfeeds pretty much every second page..,total crap...it's more work than scanning a page at a time on a flatbed
customer_reviews.author: Buddy

customer_reviews.title: Its good when it works.
customer_reviews.text: This product is good when it connects to my laptop. This has been really frustrating. Honestly, I wouldn't recommend this product just because of how often it has issues. I have to scan in between 50-100 Pages a day for my job. The wifi is just too weak to connect consistently and it ends up adding a bunch of time to my work day. disappointed in this product's performance. It does produce high-quality documents (PDF) when it does work which I was happy about.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Nice home scanner
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get a feeder scanner for home. I've had good luck with Brother devices in the past, and this one lived up to that reputation. It auto detects things like color/B&W, single/double sided, etc, or you can set it manually. It also works with multiple computers.
customer_reviews.author: Denebian

customer_reviews.title: Hard to set up. Doesn't work on 5G.
customer_reviews.text: This is certainly not a 'Plug and Play' product like most Brother printers. The scanner is fast and gives good results. Getting it to work wirelessly required a call to the customer service department and about 45 minutes of setting up. This driver disk was out of date and so download was needed. It is also not compatible with a 5G network.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Leigh

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: I wish the paper guides were a little longer, because sometimes the paper tends to go in at an angle. It is important to make certain the paper-holding "wings" are extended to minimize this happening. However, it does duplex scans, does them quickly, and they come out very clear. I'm glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: ChemBob

customer_reviews.title: ... bought this scanner because it had some of the best reviews however
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scanner because it had some of the best reviews however, much to my disappointment I received a dud! My scanner immediately began to jam with every single item I attempted to scan (whether it was a receipt or a full page sized document). I tried several troubleshooting ideas from the website but had no success resolving the issue. So I was forced to return the item for a refund. Sadly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Damon A. Regan

customer_reviews.title: So far, the scanner has worked as expected. ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, the scanner has worked as expected. There have been no hardware problems. My only problem has been feeding the paper to be scanned in completely straight and that's more me than the scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Can't handle bulk papers well and pages are always crooked.
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of the worst scanners I've used. I bought it to quickly scan documents. It does anything but that. When scanning multiple pages it has a tendency to do a few then grab the whole set. Then it gets jammed. You pretty much have to feed them one at a time. Then the pages are off so the scanned image is crooked. Very poor scanner. Wish I would have kept my money as this was not a cheap scanner.
customer_reviews.author: the_gambler24

customer_reviews.title: great product. This handy compact scanner works well
customer_reviews.text: great product. This handy compact scanner works well. I use this quite frequently without issue (most of the time). The only challenge that i've run into is when I change WIFI networks. This gets a little tricky and the product needs to be set up again. Brother should make this easier to change networks since people are often on the go and interact with several WIFI networks
customer_reviews.author: M. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Even though this is a "compact" scanner, I couldn't be happier. I have used one of the other major brands for years, but it kept losing connectivity with my computer. I have not had that issue one time with this new Brother scanner. While it does not do as many pages of the bigger scanners, it works just fine for the few pages I have to scan at one time.
customer_reviews.author: Tara A.

customer_reviews.title: Pages get snagged sometimes
customer_reviews.text: Just ok. I love the auto duplex function, but it has an unfortunate habit of pages going in uneven, or getting snagged on the right side as they're going in. I use a fuji something at work, which was more expensive, but it works without snagging the pages.
customer_reviews.author: Auntiji

customer_reviews.title: Great size for occasional scanning
customer_reviews.text: They do a pretty good job for the occasional use but if you scan every day, you probably just want to get a MFC printer or a real scanner that can hold more. These things are kind of dainty.
customer_reviews.author: Justin B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome and fast! No problems with wifi or scanning to network. The only issue I had was downloading some receipt software from brother's website. But that isn't what I use it for. I need to scan client docs all the time for record keeping. This makes it fast and easy. When I'm not using it the thing folds up and takes up no space at all.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Ugh, you get what you pay for :(
customer_reviews.text: The hinge tab broke in the first 2 weeks, now I have to use tape or something to to keep it from detaching. Also, the pages don't feed straight, even before the feed tray hinge broke. Save your money, and invest in a Fujitsu or Epson.
customer_reviews.author: Julie M. Hopper

customer_reviews.title: Died after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: It died after 1 year of use. Brother wants more to repair it than the cost of a new one. I absolutely love Brother laser printers - but this product is sub-par and not worthy of the Brother brand.
customer_reviews.author: J. Warren

customer_reviews.title: This stand alone mobile scanner is great, It is made well
customer_reviews.text: This stand alone mobile scanner is great, It is made well, sturdy, and scans quickly and very very accurately. The images are sharp and clear. No issues. Also on the back it has a slot to insert small cards, IE drivers license, ID cards etc.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Carey

customer_reviews.title: Awesome machine; Bad software.
customer_reviews.text: Scanner works great, but their software (Control Center 4) is junk. Really wish they would invest a bit of R&D into this part of the product. If the software was better I would give 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Pulls in multiple sheets incorrectly, doesn't work well - CHEAP!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely terrible scanner. The scanner james frequently, pulls in multiple sheets at a time, occasionally takes a while to warm up, and is overall not a good product for the value. After trying to make this work for months, I have determined that price is a huge factor in these scanners. Don't be cheap and simply buy a better version.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An awful piece of Equipment
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is not at all what I expected. I wanted a scanner that actually worked and was able to scan multiple documents in one go. However, this scanner seems to only have the capacity to scan 1-3 documents in one attempt. It also frequently gets jammed or the software on the computer freezes and says the scanner is busy. If you're needing this scanner for an office where you need to use it to scan multiple documents, this is NOT the scanner you want.
customer_reviews.author: Affordable Roofing Siding and Gutters

customer_reviews.title: I Returned the Item, Kept Jamming & Wrinkling the Original
customer_reviews.text: I returned the item. The unit kept wrinkling, jamming, and tearing my originals. It did not work well and was not easy to use. I ended up getting a full size printer/scanner/fax (HP Color LasetJet Pro MFP M281fdw).
customer_reviews.author: Linda Gianni

customer_reviews.title: but the autofeeder works great on regular #20 paper
customer_reviews.text: This thing work really well. Takes up very little desk space. It does seem to struggle with heavy paper weights, but the autofeeder works great on regular #20 paper. The software it comes with is pretty mediocre, but adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Xdmshooter

customer_reviews.title: Bad Software does not do what it promises!
customer_reviews.text: This scanner has been a nightmare to set up. The software is the culprit, I think. Pull down menus that won't populate. The scan to network function (which is what I bought it for) will not, after 3 days of trying with a half day of my IT guy's time too, work from the push button on the scanner, you have to use a PC to function as a push button.
customer_reviews.author: hossg

customer_reviews.title: Okay for its price
customer_reviews.text: Hard to connect to. Comes with a lot of junk software. Had good experience with a Brother Printer before and that is why I bought this, but this did not work out for me. Also, the wireless (bluetooth) connection is a bit too spotty
customer_reviews.author: Smoky-Georgi-Grendel

customer_reviews.title: Not performing good
customer_reviews.text: It is wireless and portable. The scan quality is not good. It is poor to handle paper over 20. Sometime the paper easy to get stuck. Not happy about this products.
customer_reviews.author: Philly Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Very limited usability
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to do weekly scans of warehouse packing slips to send from one of our offices to another. We were hoping to do about 40/week. This scanner failed in many ways. Setup was not too hard. But the sheet feeder is weak and stumbles over creases, tears or even perforations. It works well ONLY for smooth, new sheets of paper.
customer_reviews.author: Purchasing Department

customer_reviews.title: Small but Powerful!
customer_reviews.text: I tell you... this scanner is small. But very efficient and powerful! We never had any issue with the scanner. We scan several times in a day between 5-15 pages at a time! So easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Fyrgo.dotcom

customer_reviews.title: I love how it quickly scans both sides of large piles ...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: I love how it quickly scans both sides of large piles of documents. Processes receipts less than 12 inches long very well. Cons: Doesn't process as large a pile as advertised. When scanning piles of documents, it's best to use all the same size docs. Does not process well, more than one receipt at a time. Does not process well, receipts that are longer than 12 inches.
customer_reviews.author: Cinmanncop

customer_reviews.title: My go to doc scanner
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup and excellent software that comes with it. Does two page with only a check mark in the software - easy! I have two other scanners I used to use to scan documents - a 3 in 1 printer/copier/scanner and a scanner I originally bought for scanning photos. This is now my go to document scanner which is why I bought it - no regrets. Highly recommend. I usually don't bother taking the time to do reviews - this deserved one.
customer_reviews.author: R L.

customer_reviews.title: What a scanner
customer_reviews.text: Brother does it right. Easy to setup, easy to use, clear scans and OK software for Mac. Would be better if had software like NEAT but not online only like them.
customer_reviews.author: Terry C

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner, lousy manual & software.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent machine, terrible user manual. Does everything it says it will, but it took several hours to set it up the way I want it. The software is quite poor as well. If the siftware & manual wewr as good as the machine, I'd give it 5 stars. As it stands, 5 stars for scanner, 0 for manual & software.
customer_reviews.author: PETERV

customer_reviews.title: Great for scanning ID cards. WiFi works great, Small footprint.
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what I intended it for, software setup was a bit troublesome, once I got it installed it functioned well. Install this while connected to a PC then go wireless. Scans id cards quick, be sure to set up custom scan for plastic cards.
customer_reviews.author: Hammer

customer_reviews.title: This scanner is great! I do book work for a number of ...
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is great! I do book work for a number of businesses and this was helpful to keep everything electronically! The one thing I don't like is I can't get it to go wireless on multiple networks. I scan from home and from a business. I tried going wireless at home and then hooking up the cable at the business and it wouldn't work. If there was a way to go wireless on two networks let me know!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: don't purchase this model
customer_reviews.text: Brother has some issues with this unit! I would not purchase again!!! Vendor was great! Feed issues, jam issues.
customer_reviews.author: William Graham

customer_reviews.title: This is the worst piece of technology I have owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst piece of technology I have owned. Inconsistent performance. Will not feed multiple pages. Tried to return, but apparently was just past the return date. Throwing in garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Hoult

customer_reviews.title: painful when recurring frequently
customer_reviews.text: Wireless connectivity issues. Typically, you can solve those. But... painful when recurring frequently. Main issues are related to simple scanning, whether receipts (particularly not good) and/or multiple pages or receipts. Used maybe 20 times, and ready for the garbage can. Too bad: wash of hard earned money.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as we'd expected. But for this price, not terrible
customer_reviews.author: Cindis21

customer_reviews.title: Very cheaply made product.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for less than one year. After every scan, it says it is jammed although it is not. It will not reset unless you turn it off and reboot.. Nothing in the documentation addresses this issue. I regret the purchase and will stay away from Brother products in the future/.
customer_reviews.author: Janet & Gary

customer_reviews.title: Works great, just as expected
customer_reviews.text: Works great, just as expected. Scans items quickly on duplex and very clear. I am using with a USB cable and no issues with the software. I use it to scan invoices/receipts for my business. Scanned over 500 documents so far. Very satisfied and I highly recommend if you need a great compact duplex scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Rhyne

customer_reviews.title: Not the best software to install onto your computer.
customer_reviews.text: The installation to the computer would not work and we had to go through acrobatics to get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Ps2os2

customer_reviews.title: This machine is worthless, it is not worth 1 cent.  It is garbage.
customer_reviews.text: No matter how many times you reset this machine, it always fails when you need it the most. I have never had so many problems with this machine. The only satisfaction I got from this machine is when I unplugged and threw it away. Will not by anything from Brother again. They shouldn't be even be called Brother, they should be called INCOMPETENT.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Pierre Burke

customer_reviews.title: Portable scanner with clear scans.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very compact scanner. It scanned two sides at once and scans are clear. It was easy to set up and easy to use. It is not a fast scanner but for the price, you can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little scanner!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little scanner and can also scan large documents. It took a little while for me to set up on my macbook pro, however, once it's set up, it works like a charm!! I use the usb connector to connect to my laptop. It's more convenient for me and the initial setup was easier/quicker. This is a great product for the price. Space saver too and portable!
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: If I could give zero stars I would. This ...
customer_reviews.text: If I could give zero stars I would. This scanner has one job - to scan. But alas, it constantly (and I mean every single time) pulls through at least two pages at once making it impossible to scan a document that is longer than 1 page. It's basically trash.
customer_reviews.author: K. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: When it works, it's perfect, when it doesn't, it's a pain...
customer_reviews.text: Flawless when it works... Perfect scans, very fast and great quality... Sometimes I can scan 20 pages without an issue. Then I go to scan 5 pages and it jams. Not only do I need to unclear the jam, I need to shut off the unit and then power it up again. Very frustrating , it happens about 25% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: JerryMo

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a few months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a few months. Now it believes that it's jammed every time I scan something. The document scans just fine, but the only way to clear the error is to pull the power cord out, wait a few seconds then plug it back in. Every. Time. Trash.
customer_reviews.author: redpat2061

customer_reviews.title: ... this scanner a few months ago and it is terrible! It doesn't work properly the paper gets stuck ...
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this scanner a few months ago and it is terrible! It doesn't work properly the paper gets stuck all the time, the wi fi doesn't work and even when it is plugged in to my computer I have to be adding it to the scanners all the time! I just started using it and now I can't send it back! DON NOT RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: patricia

customer_reviews.title: it works fine.
customer_reviews.text: This scanner does its job with decent software. Its biggest weakness is feeding. It's quite hard to get multiple documents to go in straight and requires baby-sitting while the scanning is going on. Besides that and definitely for the price, it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: C. Vescio

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: A great desktop scanner. My mission for this year is to get rid of paper clutter. The Brother ADS1000W hooked up to my Mac and the PDFScanner software are an amazing combination. This scanner is amazingly fast and I love that it scans double sided.
customer_reviews.author: tfreyaus

customer_reviews.title: Good basic scanner
customer_reviews.text: This is a good scanner for simple 1-3 page scans; not ideal for heavier scan jobs than that though. I do tend to have to monitor the page feeds for multi-page scans to make sure that they don't jam or feed in together. For basic scanning, however, it does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Mimi Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Love all the features this snanner has to offer. I use it every day. It’s perfect for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: T. Easter

customer_reviews.title: Quick, works pretty well
customer_reviews.text: Little disappointed that the two sided scanning isn't a little easier. I have to feed the doc in twice to get in done in PaperPort. Otherwise works pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Morz

customer_reviews.title: I have installed these in several of my Dr. ...
customer_reviews.text: I have installed these in several of my Dr. and Accounting clients offices. Quick (double sided scanning) and a small footprint. Can be linked to a printer for "copying".
customer_reviews.author: T.C. Waltz

customer_reviews.title: Love this. Makes working from home a breeze
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Makes working from home a breeze. Also easy to bring on trips, business or pleasure to keep up with workflow and follow up!
customer_reviews.author: **csp**

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 4 months. Now I can't feed anything through it without it getting jammed up.
customer_reviews.author: C. Krishnan

customer_reviews.title: Multi page easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We have a laser printer and so I wanted a simple add on scanner. This one plugs into computer and can take multiple sheets. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: Michaela Renee @UsJohnsons

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: it's really an awesome concept but I regret buying this item. it doesn't really feed multiple pages and it's annoying running documents one at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Ray K

product_meta.title: Brother ADS1000W Compact Color Desktop Scanner with Duplex and Wireless Networking,Black
product_meta.description:
Style:ADS1000w

Automatic document feeder holds up to 20 sheets of paper. Compact scanner measures just 11.2” long x 4.1” deep with the document feeder closed. Easily navigate menus, settings, and scanning destinations with the TouchPanel Display. WIRELESS ENABLED DUPLEX DOCUMENT SCANNER PACKS BUSINESS-FOCUSED FEATURES, INCLUDING AN AUTOMATIC DOCUMENT FEEDER AND AN EASY-TO-USE TOUCHPANEL DISPLAY INTO A COMPACT, DESK-FRIENDLY SIZE.
The Brother ImageCenter ADS-1000W Desktop Scanner offers powerful features for business including two-sided scanning, wireless 802.11 b/g/n network connectivity, a TouchScreen display, and an up to 20-page capacity auto document feeder, all in a compact design. It captures single- and double-sided documents in a single pass at speeds of up to 16ppm1. Great for scanning multi-page, two-sided business documents, as well as documents up to 34” long2, receipts, business cards, photographs, and laminated identification cards via the rear card slot.

ADVANCED SCANNING FUNCTIONALITY IN A SPACE-SAVING DESIGN.
The ADS-1000W connects to your wireless network, or to a single machine via USB interface, to scan at up to 1200x1200 dpi (interpolated) and 600x600 dpi resolution (optical). Its compact footprint, along with advanced scanning features such as deskew support, blank page removal, auto image rotation and background removal, make it great for a home office or small business that regularly scans and digitizes printed information, but may not have space for a larger scanner.

SCANNING TO A VARIETY OF LOCAL OR SHARED DESTINATIONS THANKS TO THE EASY-TO-USE TOUCHPANEL DISPLAY.
The ADS-1000W gives you the option to scan to a number of different destinations to help you manage your documents and workflow. You can also scan to your USB flash drive3, or to compatible mobile devices using the free Brother iPrint&Scan app4, or scan to a file, email, or image. You can also scan to a shared folder, email server, or FTP, to save, distribute, and share information.

BUNDLED WITH A ROBUST SUITE OF SCANNING SOFTWARE TO ENHANCE DOCUMENT MANAGEMENT.
The ADS-1000W includes an enhanced package of scanning software to help you manage and distribute information and reduce the need to store and reference hard copy documents:

NUANCE PAPERPORT 12 SE (WINDOWS) AND PRESTO! PAGEMANAGER 9 (MAC) 
 * Manage all of your scanned documents, as well as the other documents on your computer
 * Scan to Microsoft Office formats, as well as Microsoft SharePoint (Windows only)
 * Scan, convert, organize, repurpose, and share PDF documents 
 * Quickly merge multiple files of differing formats from various folders into one multi-page PDF
 * Scan to E-mail, Folder, OCR, and searchable PDF

PRESTO! BIZCARD (WINDOWS/MAC) 
 * Scan and export contact information from business cards directly to Microsoft Outlook and other contact management systems
 * Sort contacts by company group, category, and first or last name 

BROTHER CONTROL CENTER (WINDOWS/MAC) 
 * Configure advanced scan settings for different scan-to destinations and store them for frequent use (ie: dpi resolution, file format, duplex scanning)

INCLUDES BR-RECEIPTS - QUICKEN AND QUICKBOOKS COMPATIBLE RECEIPT MANAGEMENT SOFTWARE.
The ADS-1000W includes BR-Receipts software that captures information from scanned receipts. BR-Receipts also lets you export your receipt data into Quicken and Quickbooks software to help simplify bookkeeping and reporting5.

BROTHER SCANNERS ARE COMPATIBLE WITH THE WAY YOU DO BUSINESS.
The ADS-1000W features industry-standard drivers, including TWAIN, WIA, ICA, ISIS, and SANE, to help enable easy integration for scanning documents into a wide variety of popular applications. Plus, it’s compatible with Windows, Mac, and Linux operating systems!

BROTHER IS AT YOUR SIDE WITH OUTSTANDING CUSTOMER SUPPORT.
We offer a one-year limited warranty on the ADS-1000W and stand behind your purchase with FREE phone support for the life of your product. Whether you have a product question or a technical issue, Brother is always at your side.

DISCLAIMERS
 1. Color and monochrome scan speed, letter size paper at 300dpi. See www.brother-usa.com for details.
 2. Single sheet, single-sided, 14-29lb bond.
 3. USB flash memory drive not included.
 4. Requires connection to a wireless network. See www.brother.com for details, availability, and mobile device compatibility. The Brother iPrint&Scan free app download is not available in all countries.
 5. BR-Receipts software available via download from Brother Online (only available in the USA).
feature_bullets: Scans single and double-sided documents in a single pass, in both color and black/white, at up to 16 ppm. Duplex Scan Speed (ipm) : 32. Daily duty cycle is up to 500 scans per day
Wireless network connectivity, plus USB interface for local connections and Easy-to-use TouchPanel display allows one-touch scanning to common destinations

Easily scans business and embossed plastic I.D. cards, receipts, photos, and documents up to 34". Versatile Media Handling and Scanning Modes are 24-bit color, 8-bit (256 levels) gray scale, 1 bit monochrome
Bundled with a valuable suite of scanning software, including desktop document, receipt and business card management programs
operating system compatibility :Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8, Mac OS X v10.6.8 - v10.8.x, Linux. Operating temperature 41 degree Fahrenheit to 95 degree Fahrenheit
in length through the 20-page auto document feeder. Max. Paper Size (single sheet) - 8.5 x 34inches.Max. Paper Size (multiple sheets)- 8.5x 11.7 inches

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars572 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
